intro: Ludwigia mullertii, commonly known as the Mexican willow, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and wetlands. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Ludwigia mullertii is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions.
